did.head: Collection Summary
did.unittitle: The Westport Library Local History Files
did.abstract: The Westport Library's extensive Local History Files are a unique, rich resource that contains newspaper and magazine articles, brochures, reports, manuscripts and ephemera on topics about Westport's past and of local, regional and national interest. These items were selectively chosen by reference librarians over many decades and some were contributed by researchers and residents.
did.physloc: Filing cabinets, labeled A to E, in the Westport Historical Society Archives. Rare and fragile items are stored in the Westport Historical Society vault.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: This collection of unique records that provide an unparalleled look back into Westport's history was created in the early 1900s by The Westport Library Reference Department. In 2017, The Westport Library announced a collaboration with the Westport Historical Society to transfer, by long term loan, to preserve the Library's historical files, and to give reasonable and continued public access to these files by Library and Westport Historical Society patrons, communality members, students, Library staff and other interested parties.

bioghist.head: Historical Note
bioghist.p: Since 1886, The Westport Library has been devoted to enriching the intellectual and creative lives of the community. The Westport Library started The Local History Collection as a clippings file in the mid 20th century. The goal was to collect, archive, and make available to the public special items, articles and ephemera that pertained to the town of Westport, greater Fairfield County, and important people who lived therein. Items were added to the collection to until the early 21st century.

To prepare for the relocation to the Westport Historical Society, the Library asked local historians and archival experts to review the contents, identify documents that are unique and historically significant, and create a thematic organization of the subject folders.

In 2017 The Westport Library loaned its Local History Files to the Westport Historical Society, a nonprofit 501c3 educational institution established in 1899 to collect and preserve the regional history of Westport. The Library considerers its research resource a natural adjunct to the Westport Historical Society Archives, which houses primary documents chronicling Westport's past, and seeks to deepen the appreciation of Westport's heritage among town residents and to increase awareness of the importance of preserving the town's heritage and its historic buildings and landmarks.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content of Collection
scopecontent.p: This research resource contains clippings, brochures, reports, articles, photographs and ephemera related to government, schools, businesses, organizations, houses, buildings, sites, events and world famous and locally significant residents in the Westport, CT area.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: These materials were arranged alphabetically by subject heading until August 2017. When the Local History Files collection moved to the Westport Historical Society, the folders were re-grouped from an alphabetical organization system to a thematic one. Under each thematic category, folders are now organized by subject, arranged alphabetically. (There is a list of materials filed under each subject.)
